query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Sì come quando i primi raggi vibra 2 là dove il suo fattor lo sangue sparse, 3 cadendo Ibero sotto l’alta Libra,
query.error: **English:** 1 Just as when the first rays vibrate 2 where its Maker shed His blood, 3 the Ebro falling beneath the high Libra,
query.result: 1 Dell yw pan wra'n kynsa'n gweliow 2 le may fatel an gwaedh a sparyas, 3 an Ebro ow kodha dan Libra uhel,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 e l’onde in Gange da nona rïarse, 5 sì stava il sole; onde ’l giorno sen giva, 6 come l’angel di Dio lieto ci apparse.
query.error: **English:** 4 and the waves in Ganges begin to ripple at the ninth hour, 5 so the sun stood; hence the day was departing, 6 when the angel of God appeared to us, joyful.
query.result: 4 ha'n tonnow yn Gange ow talleth dhe'n nawves avons, 5 hemma an howl; rag hemma an jorna a veu ow mos, 6 pan wrug an el a Dhew dhe'n ni omdhiskwedhes, lowen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 Fuor de la fiamma stava in su la riva, 8 e cantava ‘Beati mundo corde!’ 9 in voce assai più che la nostra viva.
query.error: **English:** 7 Outside the flame he stood upon the bank, 8 and sang ‘Blessed are the pure in heart!’ 9 in a voice much more lively than ours.
query.result: 7 Mes a-ves an tan a veu ow sevel war an glann, 8 ha kanas ‘Beati mundo corde!’ 9 yn leun meur dres ev ow honan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Poscia «Più non si va, se pria non morde, 11 anime sante, il foco: intrate in esso, 12 e al cantar di là non siate sorde»,
query.error: **English:** 10 Then he said to us, when we were near him, 11 “Holy souls, no one goes further without first being bitten by the fire: enter it, 12 and do not be deaf to the singing on the other side.”
query.result: 10 Wosa henna ‘Nyns eus mos mos ow mos, mar nyns yw kous, 11 ene ankow sawel, an tan: mos dhe'nna, 12 ha na vynjouch dhe'n kan dhe'n nessa’,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 ci disse come noi li fummo presso; 14 per ch’io divenni tal, quando lo ’ntesi, 15 qual è colui che ne la fossa è messo.
query.error: **English:** 13 Because of this I became, when I heard him, 14 like someone who is put in the grave.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 In su le man commesse mi protesi, 17 guardando il foco e imaginando forte 18 umani corpi già veduti accesi.
query.error: **English:** 16 I threw myself forward on my clasped hands, 17 looking at the fire and vividly imagining 18 human bodies that I had seen burning before.
query.result: 16 Yn war'n dhewlavrow my a rostellam, 17 ow sel an tan ha owth ymagyna yn fethys, 18 korfow tus ow kovsas owth esa gweliys ow tanow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 Volsersi verso me le buone scorte; 20 e Virgilio mi disse: «Figliuol mio, 21 qui può esser tormento, ma non morte.
query.error: **English:** 19 The good escorts turned towards me; 20 and Virgil said to me: “My son, 21 here there can be torment, but not death.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Ricorditi, ricorditi! E se io 23 sovresso Gerïon ti guidai salvo, 24 che farò ora presso più a Dio?
query.error: **English:** 22 Remember, remember! And if I 23 guided you safely over Geryon, 24 what will I do now that I am nearer to God?
query.result: 22 Kov, kov! Ha mar my a'th ethol dhe'n Gerïon ow salva, 23 pyth a wra vyth ow th gorra dhe'n Dhew? 24 Kred dhe'n sur na mar byssi dhe'n kres a'n tan,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Credi per certo che se dentro a l’alvo 26 di questa fiamma stessi ben mille anni, 27 non ti potrebbe far d’un capel calvo.
query.error: **English:** 25 Believe for certain that if within the belly 26 of this flame you were to stay for a thousand years, 27 it could not make you bald.
query.result: 25 Kred dhe sur na’th fydh, mar yn mes an tan 26 a’n flamm ma, mil vledhen, 27 na wra possybyl dhe’th wul follen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 E se tu forse credi ch’io t’inganni, 29 fatti ver’ lei, e fatti far credenza 30 con le tue mani al lembo d’i tuoi panni.
query.error: **English:** 28 And if perhaps you believe that I deceive you, 29 turn towards it, and have it give you proof 30 with your own hands on the hem of your clothes.
query.result: 28 Ha mar byssi owth yma'm owth engan, 29 tro dhe'nna, ha gorra henna owth gorra kredens 30 gans dha dhewlavrow war an gwlas a'th dhillad.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Pon giù omai, pon giù ogne temenza; 32 volgiti in qua e vieni: entra sicuro!». 33 E io pur fermo e contra coscïenza.
query.error: **English:** 31 Lay down now, lay down all fear; 32 turn here and come: enter safely!". 33 And I, still firm and against my conscience.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Quando mi vide star pur fermo e duro, 35 turbato un poco disse: «Or vedi, figlio: 36 tra Bëatrice e te è questo muro».
query.error: **English:** 34 When he saw me standing still and firm, 35 somewhat troubled he said: "Now see, son: 36 between Beatrice and you is this wall".
query.result: 34 Pan wrugavamevelstermhagkalet, 35 trobeledhunnbyghan,medhas: "Wrugavella,mab: 36 ynter Bëatrice hages yw an walma".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 così, la mia durezza fatta solla, 41 mi volsi al savio duca, udendo il nome 42 che ne la mente sempre mi rampolla.
query.error: **English:** 40 so, my hardness turned to joy, 41 I turned to the wise guide, hearing the name 42 that always springs to my mind.
query.result: 40 vel, ow folneth ow dalleth ha bos, 41 yth trohas ow dhe'n fur savyor, ow klevas an hanow 42 neb a'm poynt sempers ow rampolla.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 Ond’ ei crollò la fronte e disse: «Come! 44 volenci star di qua?»; indi sorrise 45 come al fanciul si fa ch’è vinto al pome.
query.error: **English:** 43 Then he shook his forehead and said: "How! 44 Do you want to stay here?" Then he smiled 45 as one does to a child who is won over with an apple.
query.result: 43 Pan yth krollas y fron ha medhas: "Kemmys! 44 ow volens star ena?" Pan yth sorras 45 vel pan wrug dhe'n flogh vyghan neb a'n gwayn gans pom.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Poi dentro al foco innanzi mi si mise, 47 pregando Stazio che venisse retro, 48 che pria per lunga strada ci divise.
query.error: **English:** 46 Then he placed himself before me in the fire, 47 asking Statius to come behind, 48 who had previously separated us for a long way.
query.result: 46 Pan yth gorra y honan dhe'n tan warbarth vy, 47 ow pedas Stazio dhe dhedhes warbarth, 48 neb kyns pan wrug dhe'n fordh hir y'n rann.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Sì com’ fui dentro, in un bogliente vetro 50 gittato mi sarei per rinfrescarmi, 51 tant’ era ivi lo ’ncendio sanza metro.
query.error: **English:** 49 As soon as I was inside, I would have thrown myself 50 into boiling glass to cool down, 51 so great was the fire there, beyond measure.
query.result: 49 Vel pan wrug ow bys, yn boglyans gwydr 50 ow tosowgh vy dhe'n fordh dhe'n freskas, 51 kemmys o an tan an tan heb mesur.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 Lo dolce padre mio, per confortarmi, 53 pur di Beatrice ragionando andava, 54 dicendo: «Li occhi suoi già veder parmi».
query.error: **English:** 52 My sweet father, to comfort me, 53 kept talking about Beatrice, 54 saying: "I seem to see her eyes already".
query.result: 52 An tas dhodh, dhe'n fordh dhe'n confortya, 53 pur a-dro dhe'n Beatrice ow tos, 54 ow leverel: "Y gliw hy owth gwelas gorra".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 Guidavaci una voce che cantava 56 di là; e noi, attenti pur a lei, 57 venimmo fuor là ove si montava.
query.error: **English:** 55 A voice singing guided us 56 from there; and we, paying attention only to it, 57 came out to where one could climb.
query.result: 55 Y'n gorra ni unn lef a gana 56 a-dhia; ha ni, ow tos attenta dhe'n hy, 57 a dheuth ni a-ves dhe'n fordh a-dhia monta.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 ‘Venite, benedicti Patris mei’, 59 sonò dentro a un lume che lì era, 60 tal che mi vinse e guardar nol potei.
query.error: **English:** 58 "Come, blessed of my Father", 59 resounded inside a light that was there, 60 so that it overcame me and I could not look at it.
query.result: 58 "Dhedhes, benedicti Patris mei", 59 a sona bys yn goleudh a o an tan, 60 vel pan wrug ow gwaynya ha ny alla owth gwelas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.error: **English:** 61 "The sun is going", he added, "and evening is coming; 62 do not stop, but quicken your pace, 63 before the west grows dark".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Dritta salia la via per entro ’l sasso 65 verso tal parte ch’io toglieva i raggi 66 dinanzi a me del sol ch’era già basso.

query.result: 64 Urdh a wodha an fordh drehedhans an garrek, 65 dhegys an rann ma kyfsa an fordh an gwlaskor 66 rag an howlek kyns oedh isel.

97 giovane e bella in sogno mi parea 98 donna vedere andar per una landa 99 cogliendo fiori; e cantando dicea:

127 e disse: «Il temporal foco e l’etterno 128 veduto hai, figlio; e se’ venuto in parte 129 dov’ io per me più oltre non discerno.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 Vedi lo sol che ’n fronte ti riluce; 134 vedi l’erbette, i fiori e li arbuscelli 135 che qui la terra sol da sé produce.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.prompt:

142 per ch’io te sovra te corono e mitrio».
